==Geography and hydrography==
==Geography and hydrography==

From Dulong, it flows northwest through [[Allegheny County, Pennsylvania|Allegheny]] and [[Beaver County, Pennsylvania|Beaver Counties]], before making an abrupt turn to the south-southwest at the West Virginiaâ[[Ohio]]â[[Pennsylvania]] triple-state line (near [[East Liverpool, Ohio]], [[Chester, West Virginia]], and [[Midland, Pennsylvania]]). +
The river is formed by the confluence of the [[Allegheny River|Allegheny]] and [[Monongahela River|Monongahela]] rivers. [[Point State Park]] in [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania]] marks the confluence. From Pittsburgh, it flows northwest through [[Allegheny County, Pennsylvania|Allegheny]] and [[Beaver County, Pennsylvania|Beaver Counties]], before making an abrupt turn to the south-southwest at the West Virginiaâ[[Ohio]]â[[Pennsylvania]] triple-state line (near [[East Liverpool, Ohio]], [[Chester, West Virginia]], and [[Midland, Pennsylvania]]). From there, it forms the border between West Virginia and Ohio, upstream of [[Wheeling, West Virginia]].
The river then follows a roughly southwest and then west-northwest course until [[Cincinnati]], before bending to a west-southwest course for most of its length. It flows along the borders of West Virginia, [[Ohio]], [[Kentucky]], [[Indiana]], and [[Illinois]], until it joins the [[Mississippi River|Mississippi]] near the city of [[Cairo, Illinois]].
The river then follows a roughly southwest and then west-northwest course until [[Cincinnati]], before bending to a west-southwest course for most of its length. It flows along the borders of West Virginia, [[Ohio]], [[Kentucky]], [[Indiana]], and [[Illinois]], until it joins the [[Mississippi River|Mississippi]] near the city of [[Cairo, Illinois]].
